snippet: The general music director, Franz Welser-Möst, cited “irreconcilable differences” for his decision and withdrew from all his scheduled performances there.
abstract: Franz Welser-Most, Vienna State Opera's general music director, abruptly resigns just after new season begins and withdraws from all his scheduled performances there, citing 'irreconcilable differences'; announcement leaves empty one of the most prestigious posts in the opera world.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and REBECCA SCHMID
byline.contributor: Michael Cooper reported from New York, and Rebecca Schmid from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The general music director, Franz Welser-Möst, cited “irreconcilable differences” for his decision and withdrew from all his scheduled performances there.

headline.main: Vienna State Opera’s Music Director Resigns
headline.print_headline: Vienna State Opera’s Music Director Resigns
